Get started

The easiest way to get started with ValidMind is to try out our developer framework and explore the ValidMind UI.

Try out the ValidMind developer framework

For model developers, we recommend that you check out the running sample Jupyter notebooks and then try modifying our the notebooks yourself:

flowchart LR
  A(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-python'></i>)
  B(Notebook <i class='fa-brands fa-r-project'></i>)
  A --> C(Initialize<br>framework)
  B --> C
  C --> D(Prepare<br>dataset)
  D --> E(Run test<br>plans)
  E --> F(Train<br>model)
  F --> G(Upload to<br>ValidMind)

These notebooks show you how to initialize the developer framework, prepare a demo dataset, run test plans, train a model, and then upload to the ValidMind platform.

Check out the running notebooks:

  • ValidMind Python Library Introduction —
  • ValidMind Python Library Introduction — 

Try it yourself (requires Python 3.8+):

Getting a 404?

You need to log into GitHub.

This link currently points to a private repository that requires authentication.

Notebook Download Button

After you download the notebook source, you can try out changes locally in your own developer environment and run the notebooks from there.

Explore the ValidMind platform

The ValidMind platform is the central place to:

  • View results and documentation uploaded via the developer framework.
  • Collaborate with other model developers, model reviewers and validators, and other uers involved in the documentation and validation workflow.

Here’s how to get started:

Using a company VPC?

Log in through AWS PrivateLink: https://private.prod.vm.validmind.ai

  1. Log in.

  2. Explore how documentation and test results get uploaded by the developer framework:

    1. Explore documentation

      Check the documentation, metrics, and test results uploaded by the developer framework.

    2. Create a new project.

      Learn what the initial workflow looks like.

  3. For model validators:

    1. Review model documentation.

      Collaborate with model developers on model documentation and add findings.

What’s next

Ready to use ValidMind for production with your own use cases? Follow our how-to guides.
